thread.title: Naomie Harris Reveals Why She Only Had 3 Days to Film Moonlight: "I Had Visa Issues!"
thread.title_full: Naomie Harris Reveals Why She Only Had 3 Days to Film Moonlight: "I Had Visa Issues!"

title: Naomie Harris Reveals Why She Only Had 3 Days to Film Moonlight: "I Had Visa Issues!"
text:
Share Email Watch The Oscars® Live Oscar Sunday, Feb. 26, at 7p.m. ET/4p.m. PT on ABC, and join the conversation online at Oscar.com and #Oscars. Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP 
Naomie Harris doesn't let a time crunch get in the way of delivery an incredible performance. 
The actress talked about her work on the movie Moonlight while on the Oscars 2017 red carpet on Sunday. Naomie is nominated for Best Supporting Actress at the award show, which only took her three days to film! 
But why did she only have such a short amount of time to film her scenes? 
She explained to Ryan Seacrest on E!'s Live From the Red Carpet , "Because I had visa issues!" Read 
Oscars 2017 Winners: The Complete List 
Naomie is from the U.K. and couldn't get a visa to come film in the U.S. 
"I couldn't get a visa to come film here, so that was a problem," the actress explained. "But I'm so glad it worked out, the very last minute, they waited for me." 
So does she think the time crunch actually helped her performance? 
"I think it did actually, because it meant I didn't have any time to get in my head," Naomie admitted. Watch E!'s live 2017 Oscars red carpet coverage today starting at 1:30 p.m. ET/10:30 a.m. PT, and join the conversation on Oscar.com and across social with #oscars and #eredcarpet. Following The Oscars® ceremony on ABC at 7 p.m. ET/4 p.m. PT, come back to E! for our live After-Party special at 12 a.m. ET/9 p.m. PT. On Monday, Feb. 27, tune in to E! News at 7 p.m. and Fashion Police at 8 p.m. for complete Oscars coverage. TAGS/ Awards , Naomie Harris , Red Carpet , Oscars , 2017 Oscars , Ryan Seacrest , Moonlight , Top Stories Additional
